Yes, there are many ways that companies can actively combat discrimination in the workplace. Here are a few examples:

1. Develop a strong diversity and inclusion policy: Establish a clear policy outlining the company's commitment to diversity and inclusion, and outlining specific actions that will be taken to promote a fair and inclusive workplace. 2. Regularly review and update policies: Regularly review policies and procedures to ensure that they are free from any biases or discriminatory language and that they are applied fairly. 3. Provide ongoing diversity, equity, and inclusion training: Develop and deliver training programs that promote diversity, equity, and inclusion, which can help employees understand and address unconscious biases and other forms of discrimination. 4. Encourage and support employee resource groups (ERGs): ERGs are groups of employees who share similarities such as race, ethnicity, gender identity, or sexual orientation. Encouraging and supporting these groups can help promote diversity and inclusion in the workplace. 5. Measure progress: Set measurable goals and track progress over time to determine the effectiveness of diversity and inclusion efforts. By taking these steps, companies can promote a more inclusive and equitable workplace that encourages diversity and embraces differences.
